title: What you need to know about the plastic pollution resolution
body: World Environment Day New resolution on plastic pollution agreed at the UN Environment Assembly.
readable_content:
- **UNEP Annoucement -**
- Hi there! I found a recent announcement from the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) about a historic resolution to end plastic pollution. The resolution was adopted at the resumed fifth session of the United Nations Environment Assembly (UNEA-5.2) in Nairobi. This resolution aims to forge an international legally binding agreement by 2024 to address the full lifecycle of plastic pollution. Inger Andersen, the Executive Director of UNEP, described this as the most important international multilateral environmental deal since the Paris climate accord. The resolution received a standing ovation and emotional reactions from delegates. If you're interested, you can find more information and related resources on the UNEP website.
summary:
The announcement of the historic resolution to end plastic pollution by the UNEP has garnered significant attention and praise. Inger Andersen described it as the most important international multilateral environmental deal since the Paris climate accord, and the resolution received a standing ovation and emotional reactions from delegates. Overall, the sentiment is positive and hopeful about the steps being taken to address the issue of plastic pollution.
